ygData.subject: RE: soloing a quick question
ygData.msgSnippet: I d have to say that Lullaby is great for saving your bacon when you accidentally pull too many.  Lament is a better planning tool to let you hopefully not
ygData.messageBody:
I'd have to say that Lullaby is great for saving your bacon when you
accidentally pull too many. Lament is a better planning tool to let you
hopefully not pull too many. I currently have bothe memmed. Lament for
regular use and Lullaby for those "Oh crap" moments, or when a couple
casters try to "bring their fireballs online" (blatant KODT ref). Do we
even have fireballs in EQ? Never even thought about playin' a wizard so
never though to look.

Kitasi

-----Original Message-----
From: jhenders@... [mailto:jhenders@...]
Sent: Thursday, October 07, 1999 10:00 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] soloing a quick question


From: jhenders@...

On Thu, Oct 07/99, TommyC <uber_sorcerer@...> wrote:

> ok forgive me why do ye use lament? I took this out of my lineup when i
> got Lullabye, was that a mistake? Please explain the difference to me
> thank ye :-)

Mobs don't wake up from lament pissed off at the bard for one thing.
You'll get a lot less banged up and have a lot less downtime if you pull
one instead of trying to sleep 3-5.


--
